title: Summer Tagliatelle
introduction: This recipe for Summer Tagliatelle captures the essence of the season with its sweet, fresh ingredients. The dish combines the mild creaminess of ricotta salata cheese with the vibrant flavors of zucchini and ripe tomatoes, creating a perfect summer pasta.
ingredients: 3 very small zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch disks
instructions: 1. In a large skillet, cook the onion in the oil over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and salt to taste. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in the tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes more or until the zucchini are tender. Stir in half of the basil and turn off the heat.
2. Meanwhile, bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add 2 tablespoons of salt, then the pasta. Stir well. Cook, stirring often, until the pasta is al dente, tender yet still firm to the bite.
3. Drain the pasta and toss it with the sauce. Add the cheese and the remaining 1/2 cup of basil and toss again. Serve immediately.
